Hiiii guys  I need some suggestion for Japanese cars  basically Toyota vs Lexus .Does Lexus has premier part and build quality than Toyota ??
Lexus is the luxury arm of Toyota. Any specific models you're comparing?

Iâ€™m looking at Lexus IS300H luxury vs Toyota Camry elegance . Just wondering Iâ€™m a paying the premium for its brand   or am I paying a premium for a better quality of its parts and build and experience ?

Chassis wise I not sure but Lexus and Toyota are known to use the TNGA across Brands. An example is the Camry. Itâ€™s the same chassis as the ES250 or ES300h. Iâ€™m not sure whatâ€™s the equivalent for the Toyota TNGA platform for the IS. Maybe Corolla?You are paying a premium in terms of the make and quality compared to Toyota and certain equipment differences. Eg. Memory seats available for Lexus IS300h but not for Camry elegance.Some other differences would be like the infotainment system quality  upholstery  the trims  tyres used  etc. engine wise probably both are comparable to some extent.

Hey Martin  thanks man! Sorry to follow up with a very basic question . So in that case   does quality translate into cheaper maintenance cost later in general ?
At least from my peersâ€™ feedback who drove Lexus  not much complaints for their cars. You are aft all buying the reliability of Toyota in a way.
If you can afford the Lexus  go for it.
But frankly IS300h and Camry in terms of size they are not the same. Camry and ES300 would be more similar. Hope this helps!
Extremely valuable feedback for me for selecting my first car in my life
No problem. Happy to provide this info. If you are looking for an ES now is a good time since itâ€™s face lifted. If not the NX if you would like an SUV.
